summary: This bill establishes a Department of State Domestic Protection Mission focused on managing threats posed by unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) and unmanned aircraft near covered facilities and assets. It grants the Secretary of State authority to detect, track, disrupt, and seize UAS, with coordination required with several federal agencies, including the FAA. The bill includes provisions for research, training, privacy protection, and semi-annual briefings to Congress. It also defines covered facilities, personnel, and a risk-based assessment process.
